subtitle: A delicious brunchtime treat which also makes an exciting addition to any buffet table.

method.text: Arrange the salmon around the inside of individual 150 ml dariole moulds, leaving enough overlapping the edges to enclose the filling.
Whisk together the egg, milk and pepper in a heatproof bowl. Place the bowl over a simmering pan of water. The bowl should be half submerged in the water.

Heat gently for 8-10 min or until just setting, stirring continuously. Remove the pan just before the eggs are cooked and immediately add the butter, then the cream. This will enrich the flavour and slow down the cooking process.
Carefully spoon the egg mixture into the lined moulds. Fold over the remaining smoked salmon. Turn out onto a warmed serving dish.

title: Smoked salmon and scrambled egg timbales
